definition: to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to take part in
and/to give/together with
variant of 歟|欤[yu2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
to increase/to expand/to add

sentences.english: Products in the market have a certain visibility, increasing brand.
sentences.chinese: 产品在市场具有一定的知明度，品牌效应与日俱增。

sentences.english: David Nalbandian is ready come back from injury.
sentences.chinese: 波特罗势头正与日俱增，纳尔班迪安准备复出。

sentences.english: You're a wonderful friend, and I treasure you more with every day.
sentences.chinese: 你是一位难得的挚友，我对你的珍重与日俱增。

sentences.english: May the friendship between our two countries grow [increase] with each passing day.
sentences.chinese: 祝我们两国友谊与日俱增。

sentences.english: The speed and storage capacity of a computer is increasing every day.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的速度和贮存量与日俱增。

sentences.english: It is an increasingly dangerous miscalculation.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种危险性与日俱增的误算。

sentences.english: Xiang Embroidery gained popularity day by day.
sentences.chinese: 湘绣赢得了声望与日俱增。

sentences.english: Why is the impact of application software quality growing?
sentences.chinese: 为什么应用软件质量的影响与日俱增？

sentences.english: Traore joins a growing band of former Arsenal employees at Fratton Park.
sentences.chinese: 特劳雷加入了在弗兰顿球场与日俱增的前枪手家庭。

sentences.english: The language is rich in vocabulary and has a large number of words.
sentences.chinese: 英语的词汇非常丰富，数量惊人，而且与日俱增。

sentences.english: With the development of facility agriculture, the need of small agricultural machinery (SAM) has been increasing.
sentences.chinese: 随着现代设施农业的发展，农机具的需求与日俱增。

sentences.english: Demand for power transformation and distribution devices grows with each passing day.
sentences.chinese: 变配电装置的需求量与日俱增。

sentences.english: As imports grow, so does pressure on the rouble.
sentences.chinese: 随着进口增多，卢布压力与日俱增。

sentences.english: Every day danger mounted, he said, but the deal was bogging down.
sentences.chinese: 他说，危险与日俱增，但是谈判却迟迟。

sentences.english: Time elapses so quickly, but my love for you grows fonder.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，但我对你的爱却与日俱增。

sentences.english: Alessa's hate grew and grew, burning inside her.
sentences.chinese: 阿莱莎的恨与日俱增，在内心燃烧。

definition: day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
to increase without letup/to get worse and worse (idiom)
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
dramatic increase
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
all the more/even more/further
to increase rapidly/to shoot up
more and more
sharp increase/rapid growth
all the more/increasingly
more and more
every day sees new developments (idiom)/to make constant progress
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
